title.narrative: Bridging the Gaps - Reinforcing Integrity in Electoral Processes

description.narrative: The direct target groups that will benefit from the programme are the political parties, Community Journalists and CSOs. With regard to the political parties the capacity building efforts mainly focus on involving leadership, senior party members and technical and policy advisors of the parties. The extra-parliamentary parties will also be invited to participate, in order to ensure an inclusive process. Special attention will be paid to the women and youth leagues of the political parties. This will be done by explicitly inviting women and youth to participate in activities, and by providing them with the opportunity to speak out during discussions. The community journalists are a strong focus group within the program. The journalists will be involved trough the component to be coordinated by Media Lab (see below).

The purpose of this project is to contribute to increased trust in and the integrity of the Mozambican electoral democracy by fostering transparency and effective electoral justice while deepening democratic governance at local level.

This program is developed with the purpose of supporting the consolidation of electoral democracy in Mozambique. The program results from a consortium between IMD and MediaLab, maximizing and combining the expertise of IMD on supporting Political Parties and Electoral Processes as well as the expertise of MediaLab on supporting the development of community journalism. Although the program's focus will be on the 2019 elections, it also envisages activities to be carried out in the post-election period. This program has been developed in the full awareness of the existence of other initiatives that will be implemented by other organizations. In this sense, the program seeks to be complementary to pre-existing programs and to invest in the gaps not covered, which Domestic Observation Reports of past elections and the EU Observation Report of 2014 point out as critical for integer, credible and peaceful elections. During the 2018 elections the failure of party agents to capture evidences to add to their complaints during the elections clearly demonstrates weaknesses in the parties monitoring systems. On the other hand, although there are visible qualitative and quantitative improvements on the CSO observation mission, there are still some gaps to be covered such as observation of the entire tabulation process from counting, to aggregation and result announcement as well as documentation of the evidences.

activity-date.narrative: Bridging the Gap' to be implemented by the latter, as described in the proposal of 24 March 2019 which was revised on 9 Apri l 2019

Effective implementation of the program, looking at different components, namely: a) Support to political parties for the establishment of an electoral monitoring system; b) Transparency through election observation; c) Supporting the democratization of parallel counting through online digital platforms; d) Promotion of legal assistance to all political parties in the field of electoral litigation; e) Strengthening engagement of the journalist community for media coverage through local journalism based on electoral evidence; and f) Exchange of experience with political actors and electoral management institutions

recipient-country.narrative: The project will be carried out at national level, but the main observation activities will be in the most critical provinces, namely Nampula, Sofala, Manica, Tete and Zambezia.

sector.narrative: The percentage of execution of 86% is due to the fact that 2 activities exchange visit to Holland were not carried by 2 political parties, due to lockout by COVID-19.

provider-org.narrative: There were activities that were transferred to 2020 by implementation strategy.

receiver-org.narrative: Due to COVID-19, the activities scheduled for 2020 were canceled and the donor did not made the planned transfer.
